intro: Heptapleurum quangtriense, commonly known as Quang Tri heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to Vietnam, specifically found in the Quang Tri province, where it grows in humid, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with lanceolate leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by small, red berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
